Award Title: 1-956 M25 DBFO Structural Inspections Additional Monitoring/Auditing
Award Description: Highways England is looking to set up a contract for the provision of additional monitoring and auditing of the M25 DBFO Company, Structural Assets Inspections Programme 2019-2020.

Award Title: 2-251 Area 4 and 3 AD Commercial transition to operational readiness
Award Description:
Highways England intends to set up a contract for the supply of commercial and technical professional services to assist in the transition of our regional commercial team to the Asset Delivery approach including the development of complementary work systems and processes during the tender assessment to mobilisation and go live on the 1st November 2020. 
This is a commission to work with our Commercial team, to develop and support our direction and to be very much part of our integrated team to collectively transition to the new delivery model.

Award Title: 1-1000 Intelligence-led maintenance of roadside technology assets
Award Description: Our vision is that roadside technology assets are managed in a consistent way to other assets. This task is to procure the provision of expertise and experience to provide fresh thinking that identifies effective and innovative ways of meeting our objectives of this task.

Highways England wish to award a contract to take forward the development of Motorway Signs and Signals. This work will help release the full potential of the investment made in CHARM by removing the restriction caused by the bespoke NMCS2 protocols replacing it with a non-bespoke communications system. This along with the development of SNMP will allow Highways England to monitor the Signs and Signals more effectively by enabling a proactive rather than reactive approach to in-service maintenance. Highways England is looking to set up a contract for provision of risk management services to the A303 Amesbury to Berwick Down project.

Data is vital to road safety activity and is essential for the analysis and understanding of collisions. It is also required to enable targeted interventions and for monitoring road safety performance. It is important to understand which different user groups are involved in collisions and the circumstances surrounding collisions. This enables us to focus our road safety decisions and deliverables and to help ensure we achieve Highway England's targets. Highways England is seeking provision of the specialist technical support required to enable delivery of a range of casualty reduction interventions.

Highways England is seeking the provision of services to:
-	Maintain the Highways England Road Safety Audit database
-	Interrogate Road Safety Audit Reports and database to produce quarterly reports
-	Provide ad-hoc information from the audit database

Award Title: 5-080 Technical support for Maintenance and Renewal Contracts - concrete
Award Description: Highways England is seeking approval for external specialist technical advice to support the Contract Development and Assurance team (CD&A) in the development of the Asset Delivery (AD) suite of contracts to deliver maintenance and renewal services.

Award Title: 5-079 Technical support for Maintenance and Renewal Contracts
Award Description: Highways England is seeking approval for external specialist technical advice to support the Contract Development and Assurance team (CD&A) in the development of the Asset Delivery (AD) suite of contracts to deliver maintenance and renewal services.

Highways England's Customer Service Strategy seeks to deliver better conversations and better journeys. As we move into the second road period, we need to ensure our strategy and approach to customer service is in line with our customers' changing expectations. As part of this, we also need to develop our internal customer maturity and culture, to help develop a better service to our customers.

Award Title: 1-1114 GD 300 continued development of a modern, digital concept design for our busiest A roads
Award Description:
Highways England is procuring technical consultancy services to support the continued improvement of Highways England's all-purpose trunk roads, 
aligning the concept with the objectives stated within Highways England's Strategic Business Plan.

Highways England is looking to set up a contract for provision of specialist advisory support for the preparation of the project scope of work specification
to feed into the tender documentation and subsequent support through to procurement of a new pavement management system (PMS).

The aim of this task is to provide Highways England with a QA and Accreditation service to underpin the TRACS network condition survey (2017-2021) contract. Particularly, Highways England wishes to establish the tests for the survey, and to undertake testing of TRACS4 survey devices during the TRACS4 surveys to be carried out between September 2020 and March 2022. Highways England is looking to set up a contract for technical support to deliver outstanding works on the A11 Fiveways to Thetford Improvement scheme, specifically for the conversion of land at a site called Wangford Warren, to serve as mitigation for protected species (stone curlew, woodlark, and nightjar) whose habitats were destroyed during construction of the new carriageway.

Supplier Address - street address: Innovation House, Euston Way, Telford, TF3 4LT
Award Description: To carry out Performance Monitoring and end of year System Reviews for the cathodic protection systems at 3no. Locations (4 no. structures in total).

Highways England is looking to set up a contract for the provision of a Technical Consultancy project, to be delivered via the SPaTS Framework. The project will develop a range of capabilities which will benefit operations both within Highways England and with key stakeholders (local authorities).

Award Title: 1-1127 Smart Motorway Incident and Infrastructure Investigation
Award Description: Highways England is seeking the provision of services to Investigate incidents and collisions occurring on the; M6 Bromford Viaduct, M1 J10-13, M1 J30-35 and, M1 J39-42 Smart Motorway schemes and where appropriate, identify mitigation measures; 	Review and measure all emergency areas (EAs) on the Smart Motorway network (operational at the time of 1st June 2020) and determine the feasibility of widening those EAs where they are less than 4.6 metres wide.

Supplier Address - street address: Woodcote Grove, Ashley Road, Epsom, Surrey, KT18 5BW
Award Title: 1-1086 A38 Saltash Tunnel - Tunnel Control System FDS
Award Description:
The Saltash Tunnel is on the A38 in Cornwall. The tunnel carries approximately 40,000 vehicles per day and provides the only strategic road link 
between Plymouth and South-East Cornwall. The tunnel is 410m long is three lanes wide, bi-directional is the only tunnel in Europe if not the world to be tidal flow and connected to a Toll Bridge. 
The tunnel is operated locally and is not currently identified by HE to be operated centrally by the SW Regional Operations Centre.
